alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Fayette; Highland; Ross (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 3:43PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN FAYETTE, NORTHEASTERN CLINTON, NORTHEASTERN HIGHLAND AND NORTHWESTERN ROSS COUNTIES THROUGH 430 PM EDT... At 342 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near New Vienna, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Greenfield, Sabina, Leesburg, New Vienna, Staunton, Good Hope, Martinsville, Highland, South Salem, Melvin, East Monroe, New Antioch, Lees Creek, Reesville, Rock Mills, Morrisville, New Martinsburg, Burtonville and Plano. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for central and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
